content: What are the guidelines of having data in your crate as files? Either CSV JSON or proto? Do I just stick in a folder named data/ or do I hard code in crate as a HashMap or other data structure?

I think you can use whatever format you find convenient, and I don't think there are any restrictions about where to put it. Your choice might depend on whether the data file is read in at compile time or run time though
... now I'm wondering whether you can put DSL code in another file with my_macro! { include_str!("data.txt") }

As one data point, cranelift puts its .peepmatic files (which are consumed at build time) next to the source, e.g. https://github.com/bytecodealliance/wasmtime/blob/main/cranelift/codegen/src/preopt.peepmatic
